question.title: Eclipse does not open after it is installed
question.body:
So basically I installed the latest version of eclipse (The "Eclipse IDE for Java Developers" specifically) on Windows 10

It only opens once from the installer. From that it runs fine, I even made a working program on it. However, once I close it does not open again

All that happens when I try to open it is the little loading window that says eclipse pops up for a second and then closes

I checked task manager and there's nothing about eclipse before or after I try to launch it

After everything I've tried it still only works once from the installer immediately after I install it, and I'd rather not have to reinstall it every time I try to launch it

I tried restarting the computer and reinstalling it a few times and choosing some different options with each attempt but still the same thing happens

I also updated my version of the JDK

I even gave up at one point and tried to install it on another computer which has Windows 11 and the exact same thing happens. Is it possible that there is a conflict with another application I have?

I have even followed tutorials on how to install it properly but it still refuses to work. I am clearly doing something wrong, since it does not work on either computer, but I just do not understand.

I have spent about 2 days trying to figure this out now and I have not come up with anything

Any help or suggestions would be hugely appreciated!

(edit)

The version of eclipse I am trying to use is the Java 2024-03 (4.31) version. (from https://eclipseide.org/)

Here is a screenshot I got of the window that pops up: Eclipse IDE 2024 03

  • If there is anything I did not include or clarify well enough please let me know, thanks!
